meanings.definition: A small Jewish town or village in Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent1: Many generations of my family lived in the shtetls of Eastern Europe.
meanings.sent2: The shtetls were known for their close-knit communities and rich cultural traditions.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken visit the shtetls? To learn about Jewish heritage!
meanings.sent4: The shtetls were like hidden gems nestled in the vast Eastern European landscape.
meanings.sent5: In my dreams, the shtetls shimmered with the warmth of home and history.

meanings.sent1: We studied the history of the shtetls in our Jewish studies class.
meanings.sent2: The map showed many shtetls scattered across the region.
meanings.sent3: The shtetls gathered for a grand celebration of their shared heritage.
meanings.sent4: The shtetls stood as testaments to a bygone era of Jewish life.
meanings.sent5: Each of the shtetls had its own unique charm and stories to tell.
